paper_metadata.title: Agricultural Economics and Nelson Mandela's Vision: Poverty Reduction Through Agricultural Development

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Thirtle, Lin and Piesse (2003) use all the available data on $1 per day poverty to show that research led technological change in agriculture generates sufficient productivity growth
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This paper investigates the contribution that agricultural economics needs to make if Nelson Mandela's ideal is to be realised

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Cost of poverty reduction through agricultural research
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: The per capita "cost" of poverty reduction by means of agricultural research expenditures in Africa is $144 and in Asia $180

evidence_citations.country_citation: Economic apartheid will not end until reasonable opportunities and incomes are available to the mass of the population rather than being the privilege of the few
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The proportion of the total population classified as living in poverty in 1995 was 50%, but as Table 1 shows, the figure was 70% for the rural population
